comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: The air seems more polluted than today. The downside of concentrations of coal-fired furnaces and steam boilers and locomotives.

I think those are railway sheds if anything.  It was a popular view -

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Wait a minute - the railway opened in 1893 and I think they are building it here.  The large size shows what looks to be stacks of rails.  

So 1892?  That makes more sense with the square riggers in the background.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] It looks like a westerly wind, so all the smoke and filth from Balmain area is blowing towards the north shore.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Hmmm - the ferries and wharf buildings look more like c.1910 ...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] 1892 seems like a better date, though we will forward this photograph to a ferry expert for some advice about the ferries. Presuming you saw Catherine Warne's Pictorial History: Lower North Shore pp 67-71? Interesting!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Thanks, I had not seen that book before. I am sure this photo is the latest of the group (see note about the two houses on the ridge). c.1905?? The GoogleMapsSatelliteView shows that there is considerable room on the reclaimed land for railway sidings, piles of rails etc, beside the rail tracks - unloading or loading on to those barges.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I'm voting for post the other pics (!) ... in this pic the trees around 'Leddicott' appear to have grown considerably...the 'new' houses BC has noted are of course more solid evidence of a later date... [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] has an interesting pic... www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/8505473631/in/set-7215... SRNSW - some ancient history - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... SLNSW Star Photo Co - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=413261 SLNSW Star Photo Co - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=413263 SRNSW - ?1904 from Dawes Point chimney - www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5353034264/in/pho... SRNSW no date - looking across Lavender Bay from near 'Leddicott' (seen here on the rhs) - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... SRNSW - east side of Lavender Bay in ca. 1908 - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... SRNSW - east side of Lavender Bay in ca. 1924 - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... SRNSW ...1925...site for Dorman Long workshops - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... SRNSW ...1926...view from McMahon's Point across Lavender Bay towards Milson's Point...showing Dorman Long & Co workshops - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/search.as... SLNSW - Sam Hood ?1920s ...Lavender Bay from McMahon's Point ('Leddicott' in foreground rhs) - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=8869 SLNSW - Sam Hood ?1930s - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au//item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=8855 SLNSW - Sam Hood - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=8867 SLNSW Ted Hood pic of east side of Lavender Bay...ca. October 1930...here we also see the Milson's Point Dorman Long & Co workshops acms.sl.nsw.gov.au//item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=44074 NLA EW Searle's aerial view ca. 1931 - nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn4655969

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16170652 - SMH September 1924...pic of site of the old Milson's Point railway station (demolished earlier in 1924) nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16078829 - location of the old Milson's Point station nla.gov.au/nla.news-article16188391 - SMH 1924...item re preliminary work on the North Shore railway line Surely this can't be 1924...there's not a flapper in sight.

comment.author: 65669741@N08
comment._content: This has to be post-1905 - those two K class ferries are both fully enclosed and a fair size. Cannot be 1890s.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: SLNSW Sam Hood ?1920s - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=8869 I missed this pic earlier...despite the absence of flappers, the more I scrape around for clues, the more I think the ANMM pic might have been taken in the 1920s...in the Sam Hood pic, note the height of the shrubs/trees along the fence leading down to the McMahon's Point ferry terminal...also note the height of the trees around 'Leddicott' (the house on the rhs above the ferry terminal)...then compare with the ANMM pic...it's a pity Sam Hood didn't t point his lens a couple of degrees to the left... I wonder whether the neatly stacked piles of railway lines we see in the foreground might have had something to do with the 1924 work on the North Shore railway line... acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=193874 - It's a pity this SLNSW Milton Kent aerial pic taken in 1928 doesn't have much resolution... I suspect that a few of the houses we see here on the south side of Warung St have survived to the present day...if so, they appear to have undergone extensive rebuilds/renovations over the years...I suspect one of these houses might be 'Warung Villa'...see description in column 4 nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13504683
